Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Late Kim Ha Gyu
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Late Kim Ha Gyu 
   Pyongyang, October 11 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il Wednesday sent a wreath to the bier of the late KPA General Kim Ha Gyu, member of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, to express deep condolences over his death.

Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Peru
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Peru 
   Pyongyang, October 11 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's famous work "On the Fundamentals of Revolutionary Party Building" was brought out in booklet by the Grafica Ah Hermanos Publishing House of Peru on Oct. 3.
 He in the work published on Oct. 10, Juche 81 (1992) noted that it is of great significance to make a correct review of the historical experience and lesson drawn from the party building at a time when the revolutionary parties are turning out in a new struggle to build socialism, taking the Pyongyang Declaration as their common programme of action, and lucidly clarified all the principled issues arising in the construction of revolutionary parties.

articles.title: Mexican Preparatory Committee Formed
articles.content:
Mexican Preparatory Committee Formed 
   Pyongyang, October 11 (KCNA) -- The Mexican preparatory committee was inaugurated at the building of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico on Oct. 4 to commemorate the Day of the Sun and February 16 in 2007.
 Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the Central Committee of the party, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee and Alejandro Rosales Sanchez, chairman of the Mexican Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, secretary of the preparatory committee.    
 Stressing that the above-said holidays are to be significantly celebrated not only in Korea but on a global scale, the preparatory committee decided to arrange a wide range of political and cultural events by drawing many political parties and organizations into them in Mexico.

Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials
   Pyongyang, October 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, was presented with credentials by Wayne McCook, Jamaican ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.
 On hand was Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs.    
 After receiving credentials, Kim Yong Nam had a conversation with the ambassador.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of Japan Kyodo News
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of Japan Kyodo News
   Pyongyang, October 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with the delegation of the Japan Kyodo News headed by President Satoshi Ishikawa at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.
 Present there were Hong Son Ok, vice-chairperson of the Korean Society for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and Kim Chang Gwang, vice general director of the Korean Central News Agency.

articles.title: Congratulations to Zambian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Zambian President
   Pyongyang, October 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on October 5 sent a congratulatory message to Levy Patrick Mwanawasa on his reelection as President of Zambia.
 The message said that his reelection was an expression of the Zambian people's trust and expectation for him.    
 Expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in future, he sincerely wished the Zambian President new success in his responsible work for the national unity and the country's prosperity.

articles.title: Inter-Governmental Economic, Scientific and Technological Consultative Committee of DPRK and Cuba Meets
articles.content:
DPRK-Cuba Inter-Governmental Economic, Scientific and Technological Consultative Committee Meets
   Pyongyang, October 11 (KCNA) -- The 25th meeting of the DPRK-Cuba inter-governmental economic, scientific and technological consultative committee was held here Wednesday.
 It discussed issues of boosting economic, scientific and technological cooperation and trade relations between the two countries.    
 Present there were Rim Kyong Man, minister of Foreign Trade, officials concerned, members of the Cuban government economic delegation headed by Ramon Ripoll Diaz, first vice-minister of Foreign Investment and Economic Cooperation, and Ruben Perez Valdes, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK.
